Imagers

Imagers are used to simulate the observation of a scene by a sensor.

An imager contains a set of imager channels, each of which has its own wavelength parameterisation (called mol_abs_param) to describe how to do radiative transfer calculations for that channel. They also describe noise and resolution characteristics of the sensor.

class simtrails.imager.GOESImager(resolution=0.5, nedt=0.03)[source]

The GOESImager class represents a specific imager, the GOES-R ABI.

The GOESImager class can represent GOES-like satellites, but has variable resolution.

resolution

The resolution of the imager channels in kilometers.

Type:

float

__init__(self, resolution=0.5)[source]

Initializes a GOESImager instance with the specified resolution.

class simtrails.imager.Imager(channels: dict[int, ImagerChannel])[source]

The Imager class represents an imager used for simulating observations of detectable objects.

channels

A dictionary of imager channels, where the key is the channel index and the value is an instance of ImagerChannel.

Type:

dict[int, ImagerChannel]

classmethod from_name(name: str) → Imager[source]

Returns an instance of Imager based on the given name.

Parameters:

name (str) – The name of the imager.

Returns:

An instance of Imager.

Return type:

Imager

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the imager with the given name is not implemented.

get_rt_options(i_channel: int) → dict[source]

Returns the options for radiative transfer simulation for the specified imager channel.

Parameters:

i_channel (int) – The index of the imager channel.

Returns:

The options for radiative transfer simulation.

Return type:

dict

simulate_observation(detectable: Detectable, i_channel: int, pbar=None, shape=None) → ArrayLike[source]

Simulates an observation of a detectable object using the specified imager channel.

Parameters:

  • detectable (Detectable) – The detectable object to simulate the observation for.

  • i_channel (int) – The number of the imager channel to use for the observation; i_channel=0 corresponds to the raw scene grid values.

  • pbar (optional) – A progress bar object to update during the simulation.

  • shape (optional) – The desired shape of the output observation grid.

Returns:

The simulated observation data.

Return type:

ArrayLike

Raises:

ValueError – If the forced shape is smaller than the output grid.

class simtrails.imager.ImagerChannel(source: str, mol_abs_param: str, noise_equiv_temp_diff: float = 0.03, resolution: float = 0.5, calib_temp: float = 0.2)[source]

The ImagerChannel class represents a channel of an imager.

source

The source (solar/thermal) of the channel.

Type:

str

mol_abs_param

The molecular absorption parameterisation of the channel.

Type:

str

noise_equiv_temp_diff

The noise equivalent temperature difference of the channel in Kelvin.

Type:

float

resolution

The resolution of the channel in kilometers.

Type:

float

regrid_observable(data: Buffer | _SupportsArray[dtype[Any]] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes], data_resolution: float) → Buffer | _SupportsArray[dtype[Any]] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes][source]

Regrids the observable data from the detectable grid to the specified resolution.

Parameters:

  • data (ArrayLike) – The observable data to regrid.

  • data_resolution (float) – The resolution of the data.

Returns:

The regridded data.

Return type:

ArrayLike

Raises:

ValueError – If the data resolution is greater than the imager resolution.
